block.p: ELLEN LIMAN is to be named chairwoman of New York City's Advisory Commission for Cultural Affairs, City Hall officials say. The commission, which advises the Department of Cultural Affairs and Mayor DAVID N. DINKINS, has 15 to 21 members, of whom Mrs. Liman is one.
Mrs. Liman's restless energy as a painter and sometime writer has resulted in two books on interior design, "The Collecting Book" (Penguin, 1980), and "Babyspace" (Perigee Books, 1984).

ELLEN LIMAN is to be named chairwoman of New York City's Advisory Commission for Cultural Affairs, City Hall officials say. The commission, which advises the Department of Cultural Affairs and Mayor DAVID N. DINKINS, has 15 to 21 members, of whom Mrs. Liman is one.
Mrs. Liman's restless energy as a painter and sometime writer has resulted in two books on interior design, "The Collecting Book" (Penguin, 1980), and "Babyspace" (Perigee Books, 1984).

She would not comment on the appointment, which has not been officially announced. It does not have to be approved by the Mayor's Advisory Committee on Appointments, which is headed by ARTHUR L. LIMAN, a lawyer who is Mrs. Liman's husband.
